abstract: Democratic presidential hopeful Hillary Rodham Clinton will unveil ambitious plan to address ballooning student loan debt; plan will include new refinancing options and will cost some $350 billion over 10 years, price that Clinton intends to offset by increasing taxes on wealthy families; states will be given $175 billion in grants to help resident students pay tuition at public universities and colleges in lieu of taking out loans.
lead_paragraph: Hillary Rodham Clinton will propose major new spending by the federal government that would help undergraduates pay tuition at public colleges without needing loans.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton to Offer Plan on Paying College Tuition Without Needing Loans
headline.print_headline: Clinton Will Offer Plan on Paying College Tuition Without Needing Loans

snippet: Hillary Rodham Clinton will propose major new spending by the federal government that would help undergraduates pay tuition at public colleges without needing loans.
